search_results.snippet: Definition: A "triple bogey" is a score of 3-over par on an individual hole of the golf course. Golf holes are typically designed as par 3, par 4 or par 5, so making a triple bogey means: Scoring a 6 on a par-3 hole. Scoring a 7 on a par-4 hole.
search_results.title: What Is a Triple Bogey in Golf? - About.com

search_results.snippet: More than one shot over par is known as a double-bogey (+2), triple-bogey (+3), and so on. However, it is more common to hear higher scores referred to simply by the number of strokes rather than by name.
search_results.title: Par (score) - Wikipedia
